Race.SpecificTitle: PW Prop. No. 1 -- 1.65 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Public Library Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Lafourche, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a special tax of one and sixty-five hundredths (1.65) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $1,634,400 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating the Lafourche Parish Public Library and its branches?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Prop. No. 2 -- 4.06 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Public Library Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Lafourche, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a tax of four and six hundredths (4.06) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $4,021,600 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating the Lafourche Parish Public Library and its branches, including automation and other equipment, library books and materials and furnishings therefor?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection Dist. No. 8-C -- $45.00 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 8-C Proposition
(Parcel Fee)
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 8-C of the Parish of Lafourche, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect annually for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2015, a fee of Forty-Five Dollars ($45.00) on each lot, subdivided portion of ground or individual tract upon which is located, either in whole or in part, a residential or commercial structure, regardless of the structure's being occupied or unoccupied, and each improved portion of ground upon which a residential or commercial structure has been or may be situated and to which a mailing address has been assigned by a local governmental subdivision, a landowner, or a lessor (an estimated $90,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for an entire year), for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating fire protection facilities and equipment, including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, and all purposes incidental thereto, in accordance with the provisions of Section 1505 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended?
